creator: wes@wesbarris.com
text:
The installation of the binary version of
webapp-module-1.0-tc40-linux-glibc2.2.tar.gz fails with
apache_1.3.22-i686-whatever-linux22.tar.gz installed on a Redhat 7.1 system when
httpd is restarted with the following error:

root@red# /etc/rc.d/init.d/httpd start
Starting httpd: [Tue Oct 23 15:02:32 2001] [warn] Loaded DSO modules/mod_webapp.
so uses plain Apache 1.3 API, this module might crash under EAPI! (please recomp
ile it with -DEAPI)
Syntax error on line 339 of /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf:
Invalid virtual host name

Line 339 is:
WebAppDeploy     examples  warpConnection  /examples

The source version of webapp also fails after "configuring" and "making". 
Testing
the resulting httpd.conf file yields this error:

root@red# /usr/local/apache/bin/apachectl configtest
Syntax error on line 236 of /usr/local/apache/conf/httpd.conf:
Cannot load /usr/local/apache/libexec/mod_webapp.so into server:
/usr/local/apache/libexec/mod_webapp.so: undefined symbol: ap_ctx_get
root@red#

Line 236 is:
LoadModule webapp_module      libexec/mod_webapp.so

creator: martin@isallineed.org
text:
Had the same problem with the downloadable mod_webapp, but after compilation 
there were no problems (from a new cvs checkout).
I did this :
- checkout out apr 
- made sure catalina was working ok
- followed the instructions and ended up with this on the commandline (replace 
paths where necessary) :
./configure --with-apxs=/usr/local/apache/bin/apxs --with-
apr=/home/cvs/apache.org/www/apr --with-java --with-tomcat=/usr/local/jakarta-
tomcat-4.0.1/

I sent my mod_webapp.so, but still the same problem exists with 
the /usr/local/apache/libexec/mod_webapp.so: undefined symbol: ap_ctx_get
error. I think it is related to the default distribution of apache. Can someone 
clear the light on this ? (don't have time today to check out it the default 
apache install).
creator: martin@isallineed.org

text:
Something _very_ similar is happening for me under Mac OS X 10.1.  
Apache 1.3.22, Tomcat 4.0.1, apr_20011111051850.tar, webapp-module-
1.0-tc40.  Using the following configuration line:
./configure --with-apxs=/usr/sbin/apxs --with-apr=/Users/labrown/
Downloads/apr --with-java --with-tomcat=/Users/labrown/Downloads/
jakarta-tomcat-4.0.1/ 

after the make finishes I have a new "mod_webapp.so" but when I install 
it and restart apache:

dyld: /usr/sbin/httpd Undefined symbols:
_ap_ctx_get
/usr/sbin/apachectl start: httpd could not be started

Help?
creator: labrown@efn.org

text:
If you get a undefined Symbol you should check the LoadModule and AddModule 
line. Like these name conventions:

LoadModule xx_module            /usr/lib/apache/mod_xx-yy.so
AddModule mod_xx.c
creator: eh@pentag.ch

text:
After Erich's comments (thanks BTW) I revisited the problem and 
discovered something interesting.  On Mac OS X 10.1 Apache modules 
are installed in /usr/libexex/httpd/ not /usr/libexec/.  I had placed my 
mod_webapp.so file in the /usr/libexec/httpd/ directory and specified the 
same directory in my httpd.conf, as you would expect.  Upon revisiting the 
situation I noticed an older version of the mod_webapp.so file had found 
its way into the /usr/libexec/ directory (I don't know how... there were a lot 
of iterations, so I'm not surprized that I may have left one there).  After 
discovering it there, I deleted it and now Apache starts up correctly.  
Anyway, at this point it all feels a little like chicken blood, but these are my 
observations, and I hope they help someone else.
creator: labrown@efn.org
